comment: Casey is great, I wish he could be my professor for all my courses. During class, he lectures alongside a powerpoint presentation somehow keeping hist. entertaining. The tests are impossible if you don't study, however easy to get an A or B if you take time to learn the material since he provides study guides that are almost identical to the tests.

All grades were based off essays. There is no actual evaluation of your knowledge of history. Exams are difficult essays and there are book reports. He is just like a high school teacher that thinks he's cool. He's not cool and nor is he remotely hot and not a good teacher. Choose someone else.

If you were to listen to him it's clear he's passionate about history. However the course didn't seem set up successfully to help us gain the most of our experience. What he communicated & did was inconsistent at times. Though I passed w/a B+ I'm disappointed b/c I wasn't really led academically to gain as much knowledge/understanding as was hoped.

I am not a history person. It's my worst subject. I prefer math and science. However, I did very well in this class! Cater presents the material in an interesting, entertaining, and engaging way. Plus, he's really cute ;) No book usage. Tests come straight from lecture notes, so attend class and you'll do just fine.

Book is not needed. Attend class to get notes - you will fail tests without them as he doesn't post them online. Tests are similar to notes, but not the easiest tests ever. I'm an A student and have gotten Cs on his tests. There are 4 tests and several reading responses during the semester. Attend class, take good notes, and you should be fine.

Prof. Cater was very helpful and a great educator. He showed a very strong understanding and passion for history and conveyed it well to the class. The tests are in depth, but attendance and notes are the gateway to success. I would suggest taking this class.

Took him for summer. Midterm/ Final, short responses/video questionaires/readings. First history class that I actually remembered what I learned. He makes history easier to understand and teaches w/ ppts, videos, and pictures. I liked that we didnt use a book and instead he grouped the events based on relevance. I wish he taught more than history.

First History teacher I have ever taken that has actually made me interested in the subject. His test are straight from what he says in class/notes. There are 5 really easy readings and four test. You really need to attend to pass his class but other than that the class is pretty easy.

Absolutely love this class. Makes tests straight from the notes. No textbook use and the readings are interesting and relatively brief. Interesting lecturer, inspired me to study history further. 5/5 overall.

This is not a hard class as long as you study and do your reading responses. The instructor has a clear power point and gives you a study guide telling you exactly what to study for the test. The reading responses are also easy as long as you read what he assigns. As long as you come to class, take notes, and read you can easily get an A.

Very basic class - lectures and a few readings but no projects or papers. Prof has an engaging manner and interesting presentation but moves quickly through the material so pay attention. He doesn't take roll but if you miss class you miss the notes and the tests come straight from the notes. Plan to attend every class if you want an A.

Anyone complaining is LAZY and DOESN'T SHOW UP! I loved this class he is straight forward and tells you exactly what he expects. Show up, Listen, take notes. Period.NO, he doesn't post notes, so what your in college come to class and take them.Truly whats in notes is on test. Just pay attention. If you miss class make friends get notes that way.

As long as you go to class and take notes then this class is a breeze. He doesn't post his notes nor do you have a textbook so you have to attend class. His test are directly from the notes and he supplies a study guide. If you have an opportunity to take Mr. Cater TAKE HIM. He is the best!

Great professor; really interesting lectures. As others have said, he doesn't put his powerpoints online so be sure to take notes in class! He doesn't really take attendance, but if you skip class you'll have no clue what's going on. I took this as an honours section and it was great. Our grades were basically from 2 papers, a midterm, and a final.

THIS CLASS WAS A DISAPPOINTMENT TO MY EXPECTATION AFTER TAKING A WONDERFUL, INTERESTING AND CHALLENGING HIST 1110 WITH BERNADETTE VLACHOS. BY THE WAY TRY HER CLASS YOU WILL LOVE HISTORY. BACK TO CATER, I DO NOT THINK HE KNOWS MUCH ABOUT THE TOPIC. POWERPOINTS ARE NOT HELPFUL. EXAMS ARE TRICKLY SET. YOU WOULD LOOSE INTEREST BEFORE D SEMESTER'S OVER.

Great professor who cares about the subject. Show up to class, take notes and its an easy A. People who are giving poor ratings must not come to class much because it is very straight forward. I agree some test questions may be tricky, but there is no reason to leave this class without a B. I would take him again, he made class interesting.

Not recommended. I have taken this similar class at my previous school. I was forced to take this class because the other class wouldn't count as transfer credit. He doesn't cover important events (NATO, UN), or briefly skims through (Marshall Plan, economic ideologies). For some odd reason he thinks that consumerism and transportation is #1.

Awful teacher and i dont think he enjoys what he is doing. powerpoint are not given to us and it is also an abbreviated powerpoint. exams are tricky. the only easy thing in this class is the response reading. dont take this class. i am a strong academic student but this class is not a portrayal of my ability. He is not cute or hot. dont be deceived

No easy class. He does not give his powerpoint which is all full of abbreviations. all the exam comes from the powerpoint which is not elaborated in full.exam questions are not straight forward.they are very tricky and he is NOT HOT. Dont let previous post deceive you. it is not an easy class with him.im a strong std and my grade nw is disapointing

He is no easy teacher. Very tricky with his questions in exam. take it from me, it would be very hard for one to have an A let alone a B. People just like him because they feel he is good looking which to me is nothing. Avoid him as much as possible.

This isn't any easy class. There is no book and his power points are very limited, you have to go to class and take notes from what he is saying. What he chose to cover was really weird and not relevant to anything. And he really likes to talk about electricity...for some reason it came up in every class. But he is not bad to look at.

Took summer class. Young, attrative guy. Need both textbooks. Only 3 tests then several other filler grades. Tests are very broad. He said at the beginning of semester attendance was mandatory but he never actually took attendance, but I would definitely recommend going or you'll miss out on your filler grades. Try to get him if you can.

He only lectures so you better show up for class. There's no text book used.  In class assignments are very easy and understandable if you read the material assigned, however the tests are very confusing and difficult. The tests are all multiple choice/T/F but he tries really hard to confuse you!!

Prof Cater was so helpful and if you missed a class due to DR or medical he allowed class work to be turned in online. I missed a class due to hospitalization and he allowed me to make up the test. He answered all my emails and explained material I was confused on. Very understanding and kind. Also gives a study guide for all tests, including essay
You have to try really really hard to NOT get an "A" in this class.  My lowest grade was a 96% on a test, for which I only studied about 30 minutes.

Prof Cater is one of the most unhelpful,unclear & careless professor at KSU.He teaches off of power points that come from..his brain? They are written in shorthand & not posted online.If you miss class WITH a DR excuse, he wont give you the notes or allow you to make-up work.Tests are 100x more detailed then his "notes".NO textbook.He's NOT hot!!

NO TEXTBOOK! He changed it so that you have a variety of readings available online, and about 1-2 times a month you'd complete discussions questions in a group during class. He's cute and has a sense of humor. Easy to listen to. The content can be boring, but he obviously tries to give it some life.

HE IS SOOO GORGEOUS Omg but on to the class, he is very helpful if you ever are struggling, the tests are off the powerpoints so study them, and quizzes just do the readings and you'll do well..so yes you will have to purchase the text.  His lectures are funny sometimes, overall very pleasant to listen to. Take his class you won't regret it!

He is a good professor and keeps your attention while giving notes. I got a C in the class because I'm not very interested in history and didn't really study for the tests. If you read the book for the quizzes and study for the tests you should be fine.. the tests are T/F, MC, and fill in the blank.

He was one of the best teachers I've  ever had.He understands what he is talking aboujt and enjoys to talk about it.You have the book every week.If you have ever done an AP class,this is the easiest class in the world.IF YOU READ THE BOOKAND COME TO CLASS YOU WILL PASS.

Don't take if you find yourself losing letter grades in classes as a result of failing to correctly answer questions on tests that ask you about very minute and ridiculous details that don't have anything to do with the big picture.  You might do fine if your interested in history, but if not, don't hold out for an A. B+

He is awesome!! Make sure you go to class and take notes bc thats all his tests are over and he wont post the powerpoints online. He's funny, he's hot, and I absolutely loved going to class just to hear him talk. There are 5 reading quizzes and he drops the lowest one. They're not too hard if you read the ch summary. He's great take him if you can!

Take his class. Read the book on the weeks he assigns (only 5 quizzes over the semeseter, he drops the lowest). Tests are pretty straight forward. Directly from the study guide and notes. He's a funny guy so he makes the class interesting. Will bump you if you have 2 points from next letter grade. If you have the chance, take him. He makes it easy.

I was fooled by previous ratings when I took the class. This class is NOT easy at all! I am an honor student and I'm terrified I will get my first C in this class. I'm studying for the final now- 10 pages of notes AFTER narrowing them for the study guide!! I've never studied so hard to make low Bs and Cs. Avoid this class unless you love history.
Amazing instructor!! Knows his stuff --> YOU WILL LEARN IN HIS CLASS! Tests are easy if you study for them. Funny, hot, intelligent! You won't be bored!
Take his class!!
Take notes on the powerpoints and you will pass the tests. Do the reading to pass the quizzes. He is really knowledgeable and friendly.

I really enjoyed this class! He's funny, he knows his stuff, and he tells you exactly what he expects. Tests aren't hard if you study. Attendance is mandatory (more than 3 absences and he deducts MAJORLY from your grade). He's also pretty cute, both physically and personality wise. I'd definitely recommend him.

Great teacher! Quizzes are over book, tests are over powerpoints (not posted). TAKE NOTES! I'm still amazed at the amount of info in that man's brain. I hope he picks up another class because I would love to take him again.

Cute Teacher! I enjoyed going to his class, recommend going doesn't post power points. Test material only covers powerpoints & quizzes only cover material from textbook.I had to study a lot for this class,test you really have to read over the questions, bc they can be tricky. I want him  to teach another class so i can take him again!

I enjoyed professor Cater's class! I'm not going to say his class was easy at all, he really challenged me. I studied rather hard for each test and only made in the range of 85-87 on all the tests. Knows his material, is actually interested in it too(which is refreshing). I Recommend taking him! i would take another class w/him even with my 87.5

Extremely good looking, lovely voice. History is my least favorite subject and he made it somewhat interesting for me. Also took a tremendous amount of stress of at the end of the semester with an exempt final exam :) BARELY passed the class, fully enjoyed it though. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

4 exams + final. 4 pop quizzes & drops lowest one. No papers. Takes attendance sometimes. Does NOT post Powerpoints & his exams are from the Powerpoints, not the book. You have to write out the Powerpoint in your notes the entire class period. Only the pop quizzes are from the textbook. Nice guy but be prepard for writer's cramp.

Awesome professor! Exams and quizzes are easy, but you have to go to class. 5 exams, a final, and a few pop quizzes. He tells you to get the textbook, but it is not necessary because all of his exam questions are covered in the notes.

Mr. Cater is a really good teacher. You have to go to class if you want the notes  because he doesn't post them online. He has a makeup test day on the class before the final where you can makeup any or all tests. There are quizzes that come from the readings in the book but only about once every week or so. I'd recommend him.
